intro: Knautia illyrica f. tyrpica, commonly known as the Illyrian knautia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Caprifoliaceae family. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in alpine and subalpine regions of the Balkans. The plant features showy, clustered flowers that are usually pink or purple in color, blooming in late summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. This subspecies is noted for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in gardens for its vibrant blooms.
